title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.6 - Stratification of ordinary classes and large units
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.6 - Stratification of ordinary classes and large units

State Regulations

Upon completion of the classified roll, each ordinary class
shall be stratified by performing the following operations according to the
methodology which is set forth in section
8186-24.12
of this Subpart. However, where the 1989 survey classified roll is the
classified roll originally prepared for the 1986 survey, all determinations
made pursuant to former 9 NYCRR Subpart
186-22, as repealed in 1996 are
applicable for the 1989 survey. (a) Determine the sample size for the municipality and, if the municipality
contains more than one survey unit, the sample size of each survey
unit. (b) Determine the number of
sample parcels for each class within the survey unit. (c) Determine the number of value intervals
for each such class. (d) Determine
the number of sample parcels for each such interval. (e) Determine the boundaries and contents of
each such interval. (f) Randomly
select the sample parcels and alternates for each such interval. (g) Designate the intervals from which
samples are drawn as "S" intervals. (h) Designate the intervals from which
samples are not drawn as "U" intervals. (i) Assign to each large unit exactly one "T"
interval and select the large unit as the sample parcel for that
interval. Notes
